title: Data Formats Supported: warprrr
text: warprrr package provides unified, cached interface reading variety common clinical analytical data formats. vignette demonstrates file formats supported read_data(), shows written demonstration purposes, confirms can read interface automatic caching. Supported formats: Delimited text: CSV, PSV, TSV, TXT Columnar storage: Parquet, Feather Clinical / statistical: SAS7BDAT, XPT

title: Data Formats Supported: warprrr
code: generate_patient_labs_long <- function(   n_patients = 10000,   visits_per_patient = 15,   labs_per_visit = 8 ) {   set.seed(123)    patient_ids <- sprintf("PT%06d", seq_len(n_patients))    patient_visits <- data.table::CJ(     PatientID = patient_ids,     VisitNumber = seq_len(visits_per_patient)   )    patient_visits[, VisitDate := as.Date("2020-01-01") +                    cumsum(sample(7:60, .N, TRUE)),                  by = PatientID]    lab_tests <- c(     "Glucose", "Hemoglobin", "WBC", "Platelets",     "Creatinine", "ALT", "AST", "BUN"   )    dt <- data.table::CJ(     PatientID = patient_visits$PatientID,     VisitNumber = patient_visits$VisitNumber,     LabTest = lab_tests[seq_len(labs_per_visit)]   )    dt <- patient_visits[dt, on = .(PatientID, VisitNumber)]    dt[, LabValue := data.table::fcase(     LabTest == "Glucose",      round(rnorm(.N, 95, 20), 1),     LabTest == "Hemoglobin",  round(rnorm(.N, 14, 2), 1),     LabTest == "WBC",         round(rnorm(.N, 7.5, 2.5), 2),     LabTest == "Platelets",  round(rnorm(.N, 250, 60), 0),     LabTest == "Creatinine", round(rnorm(.N, 1.0, 0.3), 2),     LabTest == "ALT",         round(rnorm(.N, 25, 15), 0),     LabTest == "AST",         round(rnorm(.N, 28, 12), 0),     LabTest == "BUN",         round(rnorm(.N, 15, 5), 1)   )]    dt[, Unit := data.table::fcase(     LabTest == "Glucose",      "mg/dL",     LabTest == "Hemoglobin",  "g/dL",     LabTest == "WBC",         "10^3/uL",     LabTest == "Platelets",  "10^3/uL",     LabTest == "Creatinine", "mg/dL",     LabTest %in% c("ALT", "AST"), "U/L",     LabTest == "BUN",         "mg/dL"   )]    data.table::setorder(dt, PatientID, VisitDate, LabTest)   dt }

title: Data Formats Supported: warprrr
code: time_code <- function(expr, message = "") {   start <- Sys.time()   eval(expr)   elapsed <- as.numeric(difftime(Sys.time(), start, units = "secs"))   msg_prefix <- if (nzchar(message)) paste("to", message) else ""   cat("Time taken", msg_prefix, ":", sprintf("%.2f secs", elapsed), "\n")   invisible(round(elapsed, 2)) } dt <- generate_patient_labs_long(   n_patients = 100,   visits_per_patient = 15,   labs_per_visit = 8 )

title: Data Formats Supported: warprrr
code: data_dir <- file.path(tempdir(), "warprrr-formats") dir.create(data_dir, showWarnings = FALSE, recursive = TRUE)  data_dir #> [1] "/tmp/Rtmp9muIp1/warprrr-formats"

title: Data Formats Supported: warprrr
code: fwrite(dt, file.path(data_dir, "example.csv")) fwrite(dt, file.path(data_dir, "example.tsv"), sep = "\t") fwrite(dt, file.path(data_dir, "example.psv"), sep = "|") fwrite(dt, file.path(data_dir, "example.txt"), sep = ",")

title: Data Formats Supported: warprrr
code: arrow::write_parquet(dt, file.path(data_dir, "example.parquet")) arrow::write_feather(dt, file.path(data_dir, "example.feather"))

title: Data Formats Supported: warprrr
code: haven::write_sas(dt, file.path(data_dir, "example.sas7bdat")) #> Warning: `write_sas()` was deprecated in haven 2.5.2. #> ℹ Please use `write_xpt()` instead. #> This warning is displayed once every 8 hours. #> Call `lifecycle::last_lifecycle_warnings()` to see where this warning was #> generated. haven::write_xpt(dt, file.path(data_dir, "example.xpt"))

title: Data Formats Supported: warprrr
text: formats read using read_data() interface. first read populates cache; subsequent reads reuse unless source file changes.

title: Data Formats Supported: warprrr
code: time_code({   read_data(file.path(data_dir, "example.csv"), verbose = TRUE) }, "Reading csv 1st time") #> warprrr @ 2026-01-09 12:10:45: Reading `/tmp/Rtmp9muIp1/warprrr-formats/example.csv`. #> warprrr @ 2026-01-09 12:10:47: Non-Cached Data Read in [ 1.35 secs ]. #> warprrr @ 2026-01-09 12:10:49: Data cached in [ 2.698 secs ]. #> Time taken to Reading csv 1st time : 4.06 secs time_code({   read_data(file.path(data_dir, "example.csv"), verbose = TRUE) }, "Reading same csv 2nd time") #> warprrr @ 2026-01-09 12:10:49: Cache found! Reading from cache. #> warprrr @ 2026-01-09 12:10:50: Cached Data Read in [ 0.456 secs ]. #> Time taken to Reading same csv 2nd time : 0.46 secs

title: Data Formats Supported: warprrr
text: Additional arguments passed read_data() forwarded underlying reader: data.table::fread() CSV / TSV / PSV / TXT haven::read_sas() haven::read_xpt() arrow::read_parquet() arrow::read_feather() Example:
code: read_data(   file.path(data_dir, "example.csv"),   select = c("SubjectID", "Value") ) #> Warning in (function (input = "", file = NULL, text = NULL, cmd = NULL, : #> Column name 'SubjectID' not found in column name header (case sensitive), #> skipping. #> Warning in (function (input = "", file = NULL, text = NULL, cmd = NULL, : #> Column name 'Value' not found in column name header (case sensitive), skipping. #> $data #> Null data.table (0 rows and 0 cols) #>  #> $warprrr #> <warprrr::warprrr> #> Warning in (function (input = "", file = NULL, text = NULL, cmd = NULL, : #> Column name 'SubjectID' not found in column name header (case sensitive), #> skipping. #> Warning in (function (input = "", file = NULL, text = NULL, cmd = NULL, : #> Column name 'Value' not found in column name header (case sensitive), skipping. #>  @ data_path           : chr "/tmp/Rtmp9muIp1/warprrr-formats/example.csv" #>  @ read_fun_args       :List of 1 #>  .. $ select: chr [1:2] "SubjectID" "Value" #>  @ cache_path          : chr "~/.cache/patient_profiles/" #>  @ file_ext            : chr "csv" #>  @ file_info           : tibble [1 × 18] (S3: tbl_df/tbl/data.frame) #>  $ path             : 'fs_path' chr "/tmp/Rtmp9muIp1/warprrr-formats/example.csv" #>  $ type             : Factor w/ 8 levels "any","block_device",..: 7 #>  $ size             : 'fs_bytes' num 679M #>  $ permissions      : 'fs_perms' int rw-r--r-- #>  $ modification_time: POSIXct[1:1], format: "2026-01-09 12:10:19" #>  $ user             : chr "shawa11" #>  $ group            : chr "gbs" #>  $ device_id        : num 66308 #>  $ hard_links       : num 1 #>  $ special_device_id: num 0 #>  $ inode            : num 6.34e+08 #>  $ block_size       : num 4096 #>  $ blocks           : num 1391248 #>  $ flags            : int 0 #>  $ generation       : num 0 #>  $ access_time      : POSIXct[1:1], format: "2026-01-09 12:10:45" #>  $ change_time      : POSIXct[1:1], format: "2026-01-09 12:10:19" #>  $ birth_time       : POSIXct[1:1], format: "2026-01-09 12:10:19" #>  @ cache_hash          : chr "265f747a8980d1483c536ce237eec00d" #>  @ cache_ext           : chr ".feather" #>  @ cache_hash_file_name: 'glue' chr "265f747a8980d1483c536ce237eec00d.feather" #>  @ cache_full_file_path: 'fs_path' chr "~/.cache/patient_profiles/265f747a8980d1483c536ce237eec00d.feather" #>  @ data_object         :Classes title: Data Formats Supported: warprrr
text: vignette demonstrated warprrr supports broad range data formats single, consistent API. combining format-aware readers transparent caching, read_data() simplifies data ingestion pipelines improving performance reproducibility.

title: Simple Example: warprrr
text: warprrr package provides transparent caching layer reading large data files common clinical analytical formats (example SAS, XPT, CSV, Parquet). primary goals : Reproducibility: ensure source file always resolves cached artifact unless file changes. Performance: avoid repeated expensive reads large binary files. Integrity: detect changes source files invalidate caches automatically. vignette demonstrates basic usage, focusing reading SAS XPT files observing cache behavior.

title: Simple Example: warprrr
code: generate_patient_labs_long <- function(   n_patients = 10000,   visits_per_patient = 15,   labs_per_visit = 8 ) {   set.seed(123)    patient_ids <- sprintf("PT%06d", seq_len(n_patients))    patient_visits <- data.table::CJ(     PatientID = patient_ids,     VisitNumber = seq_len(visits_per_patient)   )    patient_visits[, VisitDate := as.Date("2020-01-01") +                    cumsum(sample(7:60, .N, TRUE)),                  by = PatientID]    lab_tests <- c(     "Glucose", "Hemoglobin", "WBC", "Platelets",     "Creatinine", "ALT", "AST", "BUN"   )    dt <- data.table::CJ(     PatientID = patient_visits$PatientID,     VisitNumber = patient_visits$VisitNumber,     LabTest = lab_tests[seq_len(labs_per_visit)]   )    dt <- patient_visits[dt, on = .(PatientID, VisitNumber)]    dt[, LabValue := data.table::fcase(     LabTest == "Glucose",      round(rnorm(.N, 95, 20), 1),     LabTest == "Hemoglobin",  round(rnorm(.N, 14, 2), 1),     LabTest == "WBC",         round(rnorm(.N, 7.5, 2.5), 2),     LabTest == "Platelets",  round(rnorm(.N, 250, 60), 0),     LabTest == "Creatinine", round(rnorm(.N, 1.0, 0.3), 2),     LabTest == "ALT",         round(rnorm(.N, 25, 15), 0),     LabTest == "AST",         round(rnorm(.N, 28, 12), 0),     LabTest == "BUN",         round(rnorm(.N, 15, 5), 1)   )]    dt[, Unit := data.table::fcase(     LabTest == "Glucose",      "mg/dL",     LabTest == "Hemoglobin",  "g/dL",     LabTest == "WBC",         "10^3/uL",     LabTest == "Platelets",  "10^3/uL",     LabTest == "Creatinine", "mg/dL",     LabTest %in% c("ALT", "AST"), "U/L",     LabTest == "BUN",         "mg/dL"   )]    data.table::setorder(dt, PatientID, VisitDate, LabTest)   dt } lab_data <- generate_patient_labs_long(   n_patients = 100,   visits_per_patient = 15,   labs_per_visit = 8 )  dim(lab_data) #> [1] 18000000        6 head(lab_data, 20) #> Key: <PatientID, VisitNumber> #>     PatientID VisitNumber  VisitDate LabTest LabValue   Unit #>        <char>       <int>     <Date>  <char>    <num> <char> #>  1:  PT000001           1 2020-02-07     ALT       10    U/L #>  2:  PT000001           1 2020-02-07     ALT       -2    U/L #>  3:  PT000001           1 2020-02-07     ALT        2    U/L #>  4:  PT000001           1 2020-02-07     ALT       33    U/L #>  5:  PT000001           1 2020-02-07     ALT       30    U/L #>  6:  PT000001           1 2020-02-07     ALT       28    U/L #>  7:  PT000001           1 2020-02-07     ALT       30    U/L #>  8:  PT000001           1 2020-02-07     ALT       15    U/L #>  9:  PT000001           1 2020-02-07     ALT       46    U/L #> 10:  PT000001           1 2020-02-07     ALT       36    U/L #> 11:  PT000001           1 2020-02-07     ALT      -11    U/L #> 12:  PT000001           1 2020-02-07     ALT       37    U/L #> 13:  PT000001           1 2020-02-07     ALT       13    U/L #> 14:  PT000001           1 2020-02-07     ALT       13    U/L #> 15:  PT000001           1 2020-02-07     ALT       10    U/L #> 16:  PT000001           1 2020-02-07     ALT      -16    U/L #> 17:  PT000001           1 2020-02-07     ALT       22    U/L #> 18:  PT000001           1 2020-02-07     ALT       36    U/L #> 19:  PT000001           1 2020-02-07     ALT       31    U/L #> 20:  PT000001           1 2020-02-07     ALT       10    U/L #>     PatientID VisitNumber  VisitDate LabTest LabValue   Unit

title: Simple Example: warprrr
code: time_code <- function(expr, message = "") {   start <- Sys.time()   eval(expr)   elapsed <- as.numeric(difftime(Sys.time(), start, units = "secs"))   msg_prefix <- if (nzchar(message)) paste("to", message) else ""   cat("Time taken", msg_prefix, ":", sprintf("%.2f secs", elapsed), "\n")   invisible(round(elapsed, 2)) }

title: Simple Example: warprrr
code: data_dir <- file.path(tempdir(), "warprrr-vignette") dir.create(data_dir, showWarnings = FALSE, recursive = TRUE)  time_code({   haven::write_sas(     lab_data,     file.path(data_dir, "lab_data.sas7bdat")   ) }, message = "write a .sas7bdat file") #> Warning: `write_sas()` was deprecated in haven 2.5.2. #> ℹ Please use `write_xpt()` instead. #> This warning is displayed once every 8 hours. #> Call `lifecycle::last_lifecycle_warnings()` to see where this warning was #> generated. #> Time taken to write a .sas7bdat file : 8.99 secs time_code({   haven::read_sas(     file.path(data_dir, "lab_data.sas7bdat")   ) }, message = "read the same .sas7bdat file directly") #> Time taken to read the same .sas7bdat file directly : 17.64 secs time_code({   haven::write_xpt(     lab_data,     file.path(data_dir, "lab_data.xpt")   ) }, message = "write an .xpt file") #> Time taken to write an .xpt file : 9.99 secs time_code({   haven::read_xpt(     file.path(data_dir, "lab_data.xpt")   ) }, message = "read the same .xpt file directly") #> Time taken to read the same .xpt file directly : 21.71 secs

title: Simple Example: warprrr
code: time_code({   warprrr::read_data(     file.path(data_dir, "lab_data.sas7bdat")   ) }, message = "read an SAS file with {warprrr} (initial read)") #> Time taken to read an SAS file with {warprrr} (initial read) : 20.37 secs time_code({   warprrr::read_data(     file.path(data_dir, "lab_data.sas7bdat")   ) }, message = "read the same SAS file again from cache") #> Time taken to read the same SAS file again from cache : 0.46 secs time_code({   warprrr::read_data(     file.path(data_dir, "lab_data.xpt")   ) }, message = "read an XPT file with {warprrr} (initial read)") #> Time taken to read an XPT file with {warprrr} (initial read) : 24.48 secs time_code({   warprrr::read_data(     file.path(data_dir, "lab_data.xpt")   ) }, message = "read the same XPT file again from cache") #> Time taken to read the same XPT file again from cache : 0.38 secs

title: Simple Example: warprrr
text: vignette demonstrated warprrr provides drop-, high-performance caching layer large clinical data files automatic cache reuse invalidation.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Anirban Shaw. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Shaw (2026). warprrr: S7-Powered Data Import, Wrangling, Caching Framework. R package version 0.1.0, https://github.com/anirbanshaw24/warprrr.
code: @Manual{,   title = {warprrr: S7-Powered Data Import, Wrangling, and Caching Framework},   author = {Anirban Shaw},   year = {2026},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://github.com/anirbanshaw24/warprrr}, }

title: S7-Powered Data Import, Wrangling, and Caching Framework
text: warprrr streamlines data import, validation, caching workflows R leveraging S7 classes high-performance libraries (arrow, data.table, haven). supports multiple file formats, fast caching, robust configuration, precise timing—making ideal large-scale clinical data workflows.

title: S7-Powered Data Import, Wrangling, and Caching Framework
text: Unified Data Import: Read CSV, TSV, PSV, TXT, Parquet, Feather, SAS XPT/sas7bdat formats consistent API. Smart Caching: Automatic feather-format caching rapid re-reads. Flexible Backend: Forwards arguments backend readers fread, arrow, haven. File Integrity & Validation: Validates file existence writability read. Precise Timing & Verbosity: Detailed logging timing. Modern R6/S7 Architecture: Fully S7-powered extensibility. Clinical-Grade Reliability: Built high-volume reporting multi-format ingestion.

title: S7-Powered Data Import, Wrangling, and Caching Framework
text: Custom read arguments forwarded automatically via ... read_fun_args.

title: S7-Powered Data Import, Wrangling, and Caching Framework
text: Development version:
code: install.packages("warprrr") remotes::install_github("anirbanshaw24/warprrr")

title: S7-Powered Data Import, Wrangling, and Caching Framework
code: library(warprrr)  dat <- data.frame(id = 1:3, val = c("A", "B", "C")) utils::write.csv(dat, "test.csv", row.names = FALSE)  df1 <- read_data("test.csv", verbose = TRUE)$data df2 <- read_data("test.csv", verbose = TRUE)$data

title: S7-Powered Data Import, Wrangling, and Caching Framework
code: df_small <- read_data("huge.csv", nrows = 100)$data

title: S7-Powered Data Import, Wrangling, and Caching Framework
code: df <- read_data("file.csv", cache_path = tempdir())$data

title: S7-Powered Data Import, Wrangling, and Caching Framework
code: timing <- time_taken_precise({ read_data("test.csv")$data }) print(timing)

title: S7-Powered Data Import, Wrangling, and Caching Framework
code: files <- c("study1.csv", "study2.parquet", "study3.sas7bdat") result_list <- purrr::map(files, ~read_data(.x)$data)

title: S7-Powered Data Import, Wrangling, and Caching Framework
code: jobs <- lapply(files, function(f)   callr::r_bg(read_data, list(data_path = f)) ) lapply(jobs, function(job) job$get_result())

title: S7-Powered Data Import, Wrangling, and Caching Framework
text: Validate file paths fs::file_exists() Ensure cache_path writable Check error unsupported formats Prefer Parquet/Feather large files

what: Print a formatted, blue-colored glue message — inform_glue
title: Print a formatted, blue-colored glue message — inform_glue
text: Uses glue string interpolation cli colored output.

title: Print a formatted, blue-colored glue message — inform_glue
code: inform_glue(..., envir = parent.frame())

title: Print a formatted, blue-colored glue message — inform_glue
text: ... Arguments passed glue::glue() formatting. envir Environment passed glue::glue. Default parent.frame().

what: Verbose Informational Message with glue — inform_glue_verbose
title: Verbose Informational Message with glue — inform_glue_verbose
text: Optionally prints glue message verbose TRUE.

title: Title — read_data
text: Title

title: Title — read_data
code: read_data(data_path, cache_path = NULL, verbose = FALSE, ...)

title: Title — read_data
text: data_path path data. csv, psv, tsv, parquet, feather, txt, sas7bdat, xpt file formats supported cache_path path use store cache. verbose Whether print logs, time taken read non-cached vs cached data etc. ... Arguments passed onto respective read function. csv, psv, tsv, txt, read data.table::fread. sas7bdat xpt read haven::read_sas haven::read_xpt respectively. parquet feather read arrow::read_parquet arrow::read_feather respectively. Arguments can passed functions via argument.

title: Title — read_data
text: named list form: list(data = data, warprrr = warprrr_class). warprrr class can used observe use properties instance warprrr.

what: warprrr S7 Class for Data Wrangling and Caching — warprrr
title: warprrr S7 Class for Data Wrangling and Caching — warprrr
text: Defines S7 class handles data loading -disk caching using Parquet format applicable.

title: warprrr S7 Class for Data Wrangling and Caching — warprrr
code: warprrr(data_path, read_fun_args = list(), cache_path = NULL)

title: warprrr S7 Class for Data Wrangling and Caching — warprrr
text: data_path Path input data file. Supported formats include CSV, PSV, TSV, TXT, Parquet, Feather, SAS7BDAT, XPT. read_fun_args named list arguments passed underlying reader function. CSV, PSV, TSV, TXT files read using data.table::fread(). SAS7BDAT XPT files read using haven::read_sas() haven::read_xpt(), respectively. Parquet Feather files read using arrow::read_parquet() arrow::read_feather(). cache_path Path cache directory.

title: warprrr 0.1.0
text: Initial CRAN Release.
